sources.title: Man In The Attic
sources.description: Man in the AtticÂ is a 1953 mystery film directed byÂ Hugo Fregonese. It was released in the United States on December 23 byÂ Twentieth Century Fox. The movie is based on the 1913 novelÂ The LodgerÂ byÂ Marie Belloc Lowndes, which fictionalizes theÂ Jack the RipperÂ killings, and was previously filmed byÂ Alfred Hitchcock in 1927, byÂ Maurice Elvey in 1932, byÂ John Brahm in 1944, and subsequently byÂ David Ondaatje in 2009.

metadata.Plot: Emma doesn't like the new house her family has moved into, especially the attic. Since moving into the house, the whole family is unsettled, Emma becoming reclusive. One day Emma is in the attic alone and is attacked by what appears to be her identical twin. Emma sets out to find out the riddle set before her.
metadata.Writer: Tom Malloy (screenplay), Tom Malloy (story), Robert M. Reitano (screenplay)
metadata.Actors: Elisabeth Moss, Catherine Mary Stewart, John Savage, Tom Malloy
